job_title: Medical Receptionist/Office Managger/Medical Assistant in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Got to interact with patients.
cons: Pay suppose to be bi-weekly. Pay day would come and he would hide because he wasn't paying us. Always had problem getting paid. He  would make sad face and cry he's broke. Than when he did pay our checks were getting smaller and smaller. His response to that is, he just didn't feel like we did enough work. Some people stayed even after not getting paid for the month. He knew he could get away with it. Its a low income neighborhood and he treats them as they are uneducated and they should be grateful for what they do get.

review_title: I would never recommend KJMC as a place to work
pros: The benefits are comparable and fairly competitive.  The work week is limited to 35 hours per week.  They are generous with sick time.
cons: The managment is neither skilled nor competent.  The morale is incredibly low.  There is a union mentality so there is no incentive to try harder or do better.  The atmosphere is punative.

review_title: Depends on your supervisor - in general the staff is overworked and stressed out
pros: My supervisor was really nice and my coworkers were generally really friendly
cons: There are staff shortages due to poor upper-management. Everyone is overworked and this makes people cranky and stressed out. Sometimes your receive work from people you are supposed to build on and you can tell people are just BS-ing because they were given too many assignments.

review_title: Great pay, great benefits from 1199 union.
pros: Great pay, great benefits. Awesome staff. Community hospital and great experience working there. Would recommend for new grads and experienced therapist as well.
cons: Working 5 days a week, 8 hour shifts at this place as a respiratory therapist is really tough if you have multiple jobs. So only con is 8 hour shifts 5 days a week.
